resources.string:
This application was made to help people explore Carteret County historical locations. 
Please do the following to use this application. 
Click on the city youre in or you wish to visit.
 Following this, click on the location you would like to check out.
 You should now be prompted with several buttons. 

 (Buttons have change. We need to add what they do) 

 Please feel free to e-mail me if a place is missed marked, 
or if a place should be added to the list. 
If you feel a place should be added, 
please make sure its historical. Giving its historical or a museum,
 please e-mail me the name of the place,
 where it is, and some facts about it. You can e-mail me by clicking the button below. 


 (Within the button and the e-mail the button sends the e-mail too) craigbennettii@techreviewsandhelp.com 

 (Below is the TTS. This will change before we whenever we are done with this.) 

 
This application was made by Craig Bennett, to help people explore Carteret County historical locations.
 Please do the following to use this application. Click on the city youre in or you wish to visit. Following this, click on the location you would like to check out. 
You should now be prompted with several buttons. 
The Go back button takes you to the previous screen. 
The Directions button will pull up Google Maps. 
The phone should automatically try to find your location, and it will try to direct you to the location of what you picked. 
(This may require a working data network) The Street view button will pull up the Street View of the area you are checking out. 
(This feature requires a working data network) the Play button will have me read the text below the cyan line. 
Keep in mind, you may want to adjust Below the cyan line is a summary of the place. To get the fullest experience, 
please visit the places listed. Please feel free to e-mail Craig if a place is missed marked, or if a place should be added to the list. 
If you feel a place should be added, please make sure its historical in some way. Giving its historical or a museum,
 please e-mail craig the name of the place, where it is, and some facts about it. The more detailed you are, the better the out come maybe.
 You can e-mail craig by clicking the button below. You may hear this message again by clicking the play button above.
